Class PaginationTableScreen<T>

java.lang.Object
com.group6.hms.framework.screens.Screen
com.group6.hms.framework.screens.option.OptionScreen
com.group6.hms.framework.screens.pagination.PaginationTableScreen<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of items to be displayed in the table.
All Implemented Interfaces:
ScreenLifeCycle
Direct Known Subclasses:
AcceptOrDeclineScreen, AdminViewAndManageMedicationScreen, CancelAppointmentScreen, PharmacistViewAndManageMedicationScreen, RescheduleAppointmentScreen, SinglePaginationTableScreen, ViewAndManageMedicationScreen, ViewAndManageUsersScreen, ViewScheduledAppointmentsScreen
public class PaginationTableScreen<T> extends OptionScreen
PaginationTableScreen provides a reusable component to display and manage tables with pagination functionality in a console-based UI.

    • onStart

      public void onStart()
      Sets the allowBack flag to true, enabling the ability to navigate back to the previous screen, and then calls the superclass's onStart method.
      Specified by:
      onStart in interface ScreenLifeCycle
      Overrides:
      onStart in class Screen

    • onDisplay

      public void onDisplay()
      Displays the content of the current page of the filtered list. If the filtered list is empty, it prints an empty message. Otherwise, it prints the table of items for the current page and the pagination counter.
      Specified by:
      onDisplay in interface ScreenLifeCycle
      Overrides:
      onDisplay in class OptionScreen

    • setList

      protected void setList(List<T> list)

      Parameters:
      list - The list of items to be set and displayed.

    • getPage

      public <T> List<T> getPage(List<T> sourceList, int page, int pageSize)
      returns a view (not a new list) of the sourceList for the range based on page and pageSize
      Parameters:
      sourceList -
      page - , page number should start from 1
      pageSize -
      Returns:
      custom error can be given instead of returning emptyList

    • setFilterFunction

      public void setFilterFunction(Function<List<T>,List<T>> filterFunction)
      Sets the filter function for the PaginationTableScreen. The filter function determines how the items in the list are filtered. Once the filter function is set, it automatically adds or removes the filter option based on the presence of the filter function.
      Parameters:
      filterFunction - The function to apply to the list for filtering. The function takes a list of items as input and returns a filtered list.

    • allowFiltering

      public boolean allowFiltering()
